chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Richard Gregory Harasyn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Gregory Harasyn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Gregory Harasyn was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Richard Gregory Harasyn was found guilty of Unlawful Phone Use-Threaten w/Conceal.ID [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 3.
Defendant to report to Probation by February 17, 2016 by 12:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation. 


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Ms. Arndt.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF368, 15CF407, 15TR3827 and 15TR3828:
CO: RMW, REP: Lundmark, CLERK: Liddle. ADA Nieskes appears. Atty James Remington appears with DE Richard Harasyn in person. Case called at 3:36 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time for pre trial conference. Understands there is a resolution to this matter. ADA Nieskes recites agreement and gives recommendations. State has complied with victims rights. Atty Remington in agreeement. Requesting 10 day jail credit. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 Stalking in 15CF368. DE pleads NC to amended Ct. 2 Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct and NC to Ct. 4 Unlawful Phone Use. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Stalking in 15CF368 and court will withhold entry of judgment per DJOC agreement. Court finds DE guilty to amended Ct.2 Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct and Ct. 4 and enter judgment on today's date. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 3 in 15CF368, dismisses 15CF407, 15TR3827 and 15TR3828. Sentencing arguments. Court will approve the DJOC agreement on Ct.1. Court will sign on today's date. 20 days to file appeal.

Crt orders on 15CF368:
On Ct. 2:
- S/W 2 years probations. 50 days jail. All 50 days suspended. 10 days jail credit. Report to probation by noon tomorrow. Bond to remain in affect until reports to probation.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ms. Arndt.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
- Court costs. Bond to apply
- DNA Sample and Surcharge

On Ct. 4:
-  S/W 2 years probations. 50 days jail. All 50 days suspended. Report to probation by noon tomorrow. Bond to remain in affect until reports to probation.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ms. Arndt.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
- Court costs. Bond to apply
- DNA Sample and Surcharge

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung. DE Atty: James T Remington appears with Richard Gregory Harasyn.  Case called at 1:07 p.m. ADA Hartung calls Deputy Eric Johnson to the stand. S/T Deputy Eric Johnson. Direct by ADA Hartung. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Remington. Deputy Johnson excused. ADA Hartung asks court to take judicial notice of the TRO attached to the complaint. Court takes notice. No witnesses by Atty Remington. ADA Hartung gives argument. Atty Remington gives argument. Court at this time finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. Address updated. Atty Remington brings notice there is a new complaint and warrant issued and would like to address those now. No objection by ADA Hartung. Bond will continue.  Arraignment scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 09-21-2015 01:00 pm

15SW128 signed by RMW on 8/7/15 with Application and Affidavit. Filed in 15CF368.
Preliminary hearing at 08-17-2015 03:00 pm

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, LAA 1909 River View Lane, Star Prairie, WI. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Abide by domestic Abuse injunction and all of its terms

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
